TI INFLUENCE OF GROWN-IN HYDROGEN ON THERMAL DONOR FORMATION AND OXYGEN
   PRECIPITATION IN CZOCHRALSKI SILICON-CRYSTALS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SILICON; CZOCHRALSKI; HYDROGEN; OXYGEN; THERMAL DONOR; OXYGEN
   PRECIPITATION; OXYGEN PRECIPITATE
ID DIFFUSION
AB Using hydrogen-enhanced thermal donor formation and hydrogen-enhanced oxygen precipitate nuclei formation, we confirmed the presence of hydrogen in as-grown Czochralski (CZ) silicon (Si) ingots. Hydrogen concentrations in as-grown ingots were very low at 2.5 x 10(11) cm(-3). We found that even such a small amount of hydrogen influences the quality of as-grown CZ Si crystals due to hydrogen-enhanced oxygen precipitate nuclei formation caused by in situ, annealing during crystal growth. Reducing hydrogen contamination during crystal growth is important in obtaining high-quality CZ Si crystals.
C1 FUJITSU LABS LTD,NAKAHARA KU,KAWASAKI,KANAGAWA 211,JAPAN.

TI THE INFLUENCE OF DOPANTS ON THE INTERFACE STABILITY DURING DY3GA5O12
   SINGLE-CRYSTAL GROWTH
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
ID SCANDIUM GALLIUM GARNET; IMPURITIES; ATMOSPHERE
AB Single crystals of Dy3Ga5O12 garnets (DGG) were grown by the Czochralski method. The suppression of spiral growth by Ca2+ ions addition was investigated. Ca:DGG crystals had a strong brown color. In order to suppress this color, Ti4+ ions were added to the melt. The influence of dopants on the surface tension of garnet melts and spiral growth has been discussed.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI LAMBDA-HYPERNUCLEI BY QUASI-FREE (PI(+), K+) REACTION ON C-12
SO NUCLEAR PHYSICS A
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Spin-Isospin Responses and Weak Processes in
   Hadrons and Nuclei
CY MAR 08-10, 1994
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP MINIST EDUC SCI & CULTURE JAPAN
HO SENRI LIFE SCI CTR
ID PI+,K+ REACTION; WEAK DECAY; POLARIZATION; C-12-LAMBDA; HYPERONS
AB Probabilities of Lambda N scattering in nuclei and Lambda hypernuclear formation are studied by the C-12(pi(+), K+) reaction which gave Lambda N scattering cross section in nuclei. The results show good agreement with the calculation based upon the total Lambda N cross section which is suppressed due to the Pauli blocking and modified by the Fermi averaging.

AU FUKUDA, T
AF FUKUDA, T
TI MECHANICAL STRENGTH OF CZOCHRALSKI SILICON-CRYSTALS WITH CARBON
   CONCENTRATIONS FOR 10(14) TO 10(16) CM(-3)
SO APPLIED PHYSICS LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID GROWN SILICON; OXYGEN CONCENTRATION; BEHAVIOR; PRECIPITATION; WARPAGE;
   WAFERS; ATOMS
AB Using Czochralski-grown silicon crystals with carbon concentrations from      10(14) to 10(16) CM-3, we studied the influence of oxygen precipitates on the mechanical strength of silicon crystals. Reducing carbon concentration from 10(16) to 10(14) CM-3    suppressed oxygen precipitation and thus, improved the strength. Carbon concentration reduction from    10(15) to 10(14) CM-3   did not, however, decrease oxygen precipitation as dramatically as reduction from 10(16) to 10(15) cm-3. Carbon impurities below 10(14) cm-3   no longer affect oxygen precipitation. Therefore, we conclude that reducing carbon concentration below 10(14) CM-3  no longer improves the mechanical strength of silicon crystals.
RP FUKUDA, T (reprint author), FUJITSU LTD,DIV PROC DEV,C-523,1015 KAMIKODANAKA,NAKAHARA KU,KAWASAKI 211,JAPAN.

TI 2-NUCLEON PION ABSORPTION IN HE-4 AT 1 GEV/C
SO PHYSICS LETTERS B
LA English
DT Article
ID RESONANCE REGION; DELTA-RESONANCE; PI+; NUCLEI
AB The first measurement of two-nucleon pion absorption in He-4 at 1 GeV/c has been performed at the KEK 12 GeV proton synchrotron.  Both the (pi+, pp) and (pi+, pn) modes were measured and clearly identified, even at this energy.  An isospin dependence was obtained which was different from that in the DELTA-energy region.

TI HIERARCHICAL INTELLIGENT CONTROL FOR ROBOTIC MOTION
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NEURAL NETWORKS
LA English
DT Article
ID NEURAL NETWORK; MANIPULATOR
AB This paper presents a new scheme for intelligent control of robotic manipulators. This scheme is a hierarchically integrated approach to neuromorphic and symbolic control of robotic manipulators. This includes an applied neural network for servo control and knowledge-based approximation. The neural network in the servo control level is based on a numerical manipulation, while the knowledge based part is symbolic manipulation. The knowledge base part develops control strategies symbolically for the servo level. The neural network compensates for vagueness in the control strategies, nonlinearities of the system and uncertainties in its environment using neuromorphic control.
RP SHIBATA, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT MECHANOINFORMAT & SYST,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI TIO2 THIN-FILMS FORMED BY ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE PLASMA OXIDATION
   AT HIGH-TEMPERATURE AND THEIR APPLICATION TO CAPACITOR DIELECTRICS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE THIN FILMS; ECR; PLASMA OXIDATION; TIO2; RUTILE; CAPACITOR
AB Low-leakage-current rutile-TiO2 thin films were fabricated by electron cyclotron resonance (ECR) plasma oxidation of Ti thin films. Rutile-TiO2 thin films could be obtained at substrate temperatures above 280 degrees C. A relative dielectric constant of about 120 was obtained at substrate temperatures above 390 degrees C. Leakage current characteristics of the TiO2 thin films were improved by using high-temperature plasma oxidation and high-work-function electrodes. A leakage current of less than 1x10(-8) A/cm(2) at an applied voltage of 1.25 V was obtained for a Au/TiO2/Pt capacitor with SiO2 equivalent thickness of 4.9 nm.
RP ABE, Y (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,HITACHI RES LAB,7-1-1 OMIKA CHO,HITACHI,IBARAKI 31912,JAPAN.

TI CRYSTAL-GROWTH OF DISLOCATION-FREE LINBO3 SINGLE-CRYSTALS BY
   MICRO-PULLING-DOWN METHOD
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
ID NIOBATE FIBERS
AB LiNbO3 micro single crystals were successfully grown by a crystal growth method using a micro nozzle in the bottom of a crucible.  By this method, crack-free LiNbO3 single crystals have been grown along the x, y and z axes having diameters of 60-800 mum, independent of the growth axis, growth rate and melt composition.  Very high growth rates of up to 90 mm/h have been used without lessening of crystal quality.  The grown crystals were revealed to be free of dislocations and subgrain boundaries up to 500 mum in diameter, as determined by X-ray topography and etching technique.
C1 ELECTROTECH LAB,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI PERMEATION OF CARBON-DIOXIDE IN GLASSY POLY(ETHER IMIDE) AND POLY(ETHER
   ETHER KETONE) MEMBRANES
SO JOURNAL OF MEMBRANE SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
DE PERMEABILITY; POLY(ETHER IMIDE); POLY(ETHER ETHER KETONE); DUAL-MODE
   MODEL; CARBON DIOXIDE
ID SORPTION; TRANSPORT; POLYMERS; DIFFUSION; GASES
AB Sorption equilibria and permeation rates for CO2, O2 and N2 in poly(ether imide) (PEI) membrane which has a glass-transition temperature of 216-degrees-C and in poly(ether ether ketone) (PEEK) (a typical crystalline polymer, crystallinity=0.4) membrane, whose glass-transition temperature is 143-degrees-C, were measured at 25, 30 and 40-degrees-C and at pressures up to 3 MPa. The pressure dependence of the mean permeability coefficients of PEEK membrane to 02 and CO2 obeyed the conventional dual-mode mobility model, whereas that of PEI membrane to CO2 did not follow the conventional dual-mode mobility model. A modified dual-mode mobility model which takes into account four kinds of diffusive movements was satisfactorily used to simulate the pressure dependence.

TI INTERNAL RADIATIVE HEAT-TRANSFER IN CZOCHRALSKI GROWTH OF LITAO3
   SINGLE-CRYSTAL
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
ID SHAPED SEMITRANSPARENT CRYSTALS; VERTICAL BRIDGMAN GROWTH; MELT;
   CONVECTION; ATMOSPHERE; GARNET
AB In order to investigate the effect of internal radiative heat transfer on growth behavior in the oxide Czochralski single crystal growth process, differently colored LiTaO3 single crystals were grown in N2 + 0.5 vol% O2 and N2 atmospheres.  In the N2 + O2 atmosphere, transparent yellow crystals of 55 mm in diameter and 70 mm in length could easily be grown.  The crystals have convex interfaces toward the melt.  On the other hand, the crystals grown in the N2 atmosphere are brown because of O2 deficiency.  The brown crystals have concave interfaces and it was difficult to grow long crystals by using the hot zone with the same structure as that used in the N2 + O2 atmosphere.  From measurements of temperature gradient in the growth furnace, temperature changes around crystals in the crucible with O2 introduction into the N2 atmosphere and emitted spectra from growing crystals in the N2 and N2 + O2 atmospheres, it is concluded that increase of the resistance to heat transfer due to the suppression of the internal radiative heat transfer in the colored crystals is responsible for the growth difficulties such as concave interfaces.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI COMPARISON OF HEME ENVIRONMENT AT THE PUTATIVE DISTAL REGION OF P-450S
   UTILIZING THEIR EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL NITROGENOUS LIGAND BOUND FORMS
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA-PROTEIN STRUCTURE AND MOLECULAR ENZYMOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
DE CYTOCHROME P-450; CYTOCHROME P-450 2E1; ABSORPTION SPECTRUM; LIGAND
   INTERACTION; HEME ENVIRONMENT
ID CYTOCHROMES-P-450 LAURATE (OMEGA-1)-HYDROXYLASE; SITE-DIRECTED
   MUTAGENESIS; TRANSFORMED YEAST-CELLS; PHENYL-IRON COMPLEXES; RABBIT
   LIVER; TESTOSTERONE 16-ALPHA-HYDROXYLASE; CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; MICROSOMAL
   CYTOCHROME-P-450; INSITU REARRANGEMENT; HYDROXYLASE-ACTIVITY
AB Thr-303 to Lys-mutated P-450 2E1 (1), as well as Thr-301 to Lys-mutated P-450 2C2, had absorption spectra characteristic of a nitrogenous ligand-bound form of P-450, such as the pyridine complex of P-450 2E1; (i) in the ferric state, the red-shifted Soret band, compared with the typical low-spin type spectrum of P-450, and the more intense beta band than the alpha band and (ii) in the ferrous state, two Soret peaks at around 447 and 422 nm, the relative intensities of which depended on pH, indicating the existence of two inconvertible states. The equilibrium between the two states of the mutated P-450 2E1 appeared to be shifted toward the 422 nm state, compared with the mutated P-450 2C2. The corresponding mutant of P-450 2C14 had similar spectral properties to those of both mutated P-450s except that the shorter of the two Soret bands of its ferrous form was relatively broad and appeared at 418 nm. These findings suggest that the epsilon-amino-nitrogen of the Lys of the mutated P-450s is located in the appropriate position to occupy the sixth coordination position with the heme iron and spatial differences exist in the essentially conserved structure of the distal heme domain among the three ferrous Lys-mutated P-450s.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,INST PROT RES,SUITA,OSAKA 565,JAPAN.

TI H-MODE PROPERTIES OF JT-60-U DISCHARGES IN DIFFERENT COLLISIONALITY
   REGIMES
SO PLASMA PHYSICS AND CONTROLLED FUSION
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4th H-Mode Workshop (IAEA Technical Committee Meeting on H-Mode Physics)
CY NOV 15-17, 1993
CL NAKA, JAPAN
SP INT ATOM ENERGY AGCY
ID POLOIDAL ROTATION; TRANSITION; TOKAMAK; BIFURCATION
AB Various features of H-mode observed in the JT-60 U tokamak have been intensively investigated with respect to the effective edge ion collisionality v(i eff)*, which takes the impurity contribution into consideration. Cumulated data exhibits v(i eff)* at the transition does vary, depending upon target density, magnetic field, equilibrium profile and the heating beam power. Scatters in the v(i eff)* have been categorized into three regions: low field, hot-ion mode and high-betap mode regime. In all the regimes reduced turbulent density fluctuation was observed across the transition, which is a result of the decrease of coherence in the edge density fluctuation and increase in the radial shearing of the poloidal flow velocity. Reflectometric technique and fast-sample magnetic probes were used for the turbulence diagnostics in this work. It was also documented that turbulent density fluctuation inversely scales with shear in the poloidal flow velocity in the low-field H-mode. Particularly in high-betap H-mode discharge, the poloidal rotation is in the ion diamagnetic direction, and enhanced magnetic turbulence was observed, which may invoke the theoretical considerations regarding the role of magnetic turbulence as a cause of the H-mode transition.
RP FUKUDA, T (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA FUS RES ESTAB,NAKA,IBARAKI 31101,JAPAN.

TI INTERNAL TRANSPORT BARRIER ON Q=3 SURFACE AND POLOIDAL PLASMA SPIN-UP IN
   JT-60U HIGH-BETA(P) DISCHARGES
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID ENERGY CONFINEMENT; BOOTSTRAP CURRENT; TOKAMAK; BORONIZATION;
   TRANSITION; ROTATION; PROFILES
AB Spontaneous formation of an internal transport barrier was observed associated with improved confinement in the high-beta(p) discharges in the JT-60U tokamak. The radial location of the transport barrier was found to be on the q = 3 surface. A fast magnetohydrodynamic event localized at the transport barrier triggered the subsequent formation of an edge transport barrier that resulted in the further confinement improvement. In these discharges, a high poloidal plasma rotation velocity that significantly exceeded the prediction of the present neoclassical theory was also observed at r/a = 0.8.
RP KOIDE, Y (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA FUS RES ESTAB,NAKA,IBARAKI 31101,JAPAN.

TI COATING OF PHARMACEUTICAL POWDERS BY FLUIDIZED-BED PROCESS .6.
   MICROENCAPSULATION USING BLEND AND COMPOSITE LATICES OF COPOLY(ETHYL
   ACRYLATE-METHYL METHACRYLATE-2-HYDROXYETHYL METHACRYLATE)
SO CHEMICAL & PHARMACEUTICAL BULLETIN
LA English
DT Article
DE COATING; COMPOSITE LATEX; SPOUTED BED; MICROCAPSULE; AGGLOMERATION;
   COPOLY(ETHYL ACRYLATE-METHYL METHACRYLATE-2-HYDROXYETHYL METHACRYLATE)
ID PERCOLATION THEORY; WURSTER PROCESS; ETHYL CELLULOSE; SYSTEMS; FILM;
   AGGLOMERATION
AB An aqueous acrylic latex which could exhibit a low degree of agglomeration, low membrane permeation and high coating efficiency was developed using copoly(ethyl acrylate (EA)-methyl methacrylate (MMA)-2-hydroxyethyl methacrylate (HEMA)) whose molar ratio was 6:12:8 or 12:6:4. Blend latices composed of the hydrophilic 6:12:8 latex and the hydrophobic 12:6:4 latex exhibited a very low degree of agglomeration. However, the coating operation had problems with particle adhesion and cohesion due to the low softening temperature (26 degrees C) of the 12:6:4 copolymer. In addition, the release of lactose from the microcapsules coated with the substances, even if cured by heating, could not be sufficiently suppressed, with a fraction of fast releasing microcapsules remaining due to a variation of the membrane structure formed by the random packing of latex particles. Hence, composite latices composed of the low permeable 12:6:4 copolymer core and the nonadhesive 6:12:8 polymer shell were synthesized. A 6:4 (core:shell) composite latex formed a low permeable membrane by curing, so that the microcapsules of 53-63 mu m lactose 40% coated with it released only 10% of its lactose at 3 h without an initial burst. Moreover, composite latices exhibited a very low degree of agglomeration, with the polymer yield remaining very high, and they did not induce any adhesive behavior. These properties were still effective even in the coating of corn starch as fine as 12 mu m. At a 50% level of coating, the mass median diameter of the product was 16 mu m and it contained only 3% agglomerates. These results showed that by using the composite latex, the particles of the order of 10 mu m could be discretely coated as single-core microcapsules in the Wurster process, a kind of spouted bed process assisted with a draft tube.
C1 FUJI PAUDAL,JYOTO KU,OSAKA 536,JAPAN.
RP ICHIKAWA, H (reprint author), KOBE GAKUIN UNIV,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,NISHI KU,IKAWADANI CHO,KOBE 65121,JAPAN.

TI GROWTH AND CHARACTERIZATION OF K3LI2-XNB5+XO15+2X MICRO SINGLE-CRYSTALS
   FORMED BY THE MU-PULLING DOWN METHOD FOR BLUE SHG APPLICATIONS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE POTASSIUM LITHIUM NIOBATE; MU-PD METHOD; COMPOSITION; DOMAIN STRUCTURE;
   2ND-HARMONIC GENERATION; BLUE LASER
ID GAALAS DIODE-LASER; GENERATION; RADIATION
AB Potassium lithium niobate (K3Li2-Nb-X(5)+O-X(15)+(2X): KLN) crystals are difficult to grow by conventional crystal growth methods because of the distinct change of composition. Using the micro pulling down (mu-PD) method, crack-free and homogeneous KLN crystals with a length of 150 mm and diameters of 150, 300 and 500 mu m have been grown successfully. The crystals show good structural quality, single-domain structure and an excellent second harmonic generation property. The red irradiation of a Ti:sapphire laser and semiconductor laser diode was converted by mu-PD crystals to blue laser light with half wavelength.
RP YOON, DH (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,2-1-1 KATAHIRA,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RI Fukuda, Tsuguo/D-1309-2010

TI PRESERVATION OF THE PHASE-BOUNDARY OF SI(111) 7X7 STRUCTURE IN AIR
   STUDIED BY FORCE MICROSCOPY
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE SURFACE STRUCTURE; SI(111); 7X7; AFM; PHASE BOUNDARY
ID SURFACES; SILICON; TRANSITION
AB Si(111) surfaces cleaned under ultrahigh vacuum were studied by force microscopy in air. 7 x 7 domain boundaries associated with the phase transition from 1 x 1 to 7 x 7 during cooling were imaged as 1.0 approximately 1.5 angstrom high protrusions. The morphology was quite consistent with results from in situ techniques. For rapidly quenched surfaces, disordered 1 x 1 triangles were also seen in the middle of terraces. These structures may be related to the difference in surface atom densities and the difference in reaction to oxygen.
RP FUKUDA, T (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,BASIC RES LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

TI PRODUCTION OF HUMAN PTH(1-34) VIA A RECOMBINANT-DNA TECHNIQUE
SO BIOCHEMICAL AND BIOPHYSICAL RESEARCH COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID HIGH-YIELD; BONE; CYSTEINE; CLEAVAGE; RESIDUES; MASS; ACID
AB The production of hPTH(1-34) by site specific chemical cleavage of [Cys(35)]hPTH(1-84) obtained by a biotechnology technique is described. The amino-peptide bond of S-cyanylated cysteine residues in peptides or proteins is specifically cleaved by exposure to an alkaline solution (Stark, G. R. (1977) Methods Enzymol, 47, 129-132). However, when applying this method to [Cys(35)]hPTH(1-84), we observed many by-products. Formation of these by-products was suppressed using a short reaction in 0.03N NaOH containing 6M urea at low temperature, and hPTH(1-34) was specifically produced. The product was indistinguishable from standard hPTH(1-34) with respect to chemical and biological characterization. (C) 1994 Academic Press,

TI LI3NBO4
SO ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION C-CRYSTAL STRUCTURE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
AB A single crystal of trilithium niobate, Li3NbO4, was obtained for the first time by extraction from a LiCl flux. The structure comprises Nb4O16 clusters, which form a body-centred cubic lattice, with Li ions located among the Nb4O16 clusters. O ions coordinate to Nb and Li in an octahedral manner.

TI ION TEMPERATURE PROFILE SIMULATION OF JT-60 AND TFTR PLASMAS WITH ION
   TEMPERATURE-GRADIENT MODE TRANSPORT MODELS
SO NUCLEAR FUSION
LA English
DT Article
ID FUSION TEST REACTOR; EXCHANGE RECOMBINATION SPECTROSCOPY; TOKAMAK
   TRANSPORT; DRIVEN TURBULENCE; DRIFT INSTABILITIES; ENERGY CONFINEMENT;
   TOROIDAL ROTATION; ELECTRON; HEAT; CODE
AB Ion temperature profiles of neutral beam heated plasmas in JT-60 and TFTR have been simulated using models of ion thermal diffusivity, chi(i), based on ion temperature gradient mode (eta(i) mode) turbulence and drift wave turbulence (trapped electron mode and circulating electron mode). The ion temperature profiles measured by charge exchange recombination spectroscopy are compared to predicted T(i) profiles calculated from three theoretical models for ion heat transport by Dominguez and Waltz, Lee and Diamond, and Romanelli. All three chi(i) models can reproduce the measured T(i) profile over a wide range of parameters in JT-60 L mode plasmas, except for two 1 MA limiter cases. With the use of transport models, which were adjusted to fit JT-60 plasmas, it was found that the Dominguez and Waltz and Romanelli models agree with measured T(i) profiles in TFTR L mode discharges in the region a/4 < r < a/2. The observed central peaking of T(i) near the magnetic axis of TFTR L mode plasmas cannot be reproduced. It was found that the Lee and Diamond model does not fit the data as well. The chi(i) models studied cannot consistently reproduce the measured T(i) in the peripheral region of either JT-60 or TFTR plasmas. In the high ion temperature (high T(i)) plasmas of JT-60 and supershot plasmas of TFTR, the predicted T(i) profiles are much broader than the measured profile. In supershot plasmas, the measured central ion temperature greatly exceeds the predicted temperature, although there is reasonable agreement near the edge.
C1 PRINCETON UNIV,PRINCETON PLASMA PHYS LAB,PRINCETON,NJ 08544.

TI CORRELATION BETWEEN ZNSE CRYSTAL-GROWTH CONDITIONS FROM MELT AND
   GENERATION OF LARGE-ANGLE GRAIN-BOUNDARIES AND TWINS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE CRYSTAL GROWTH; VERTICAL BRIDGMAN METHOD; ZNSE; GRAIN BOUNDARIES; TWINS;
   MELT SUPERHEATING
ID ZINC SELENIDE CRYSTALS; BRIDGMAN GROWTH; ARGON PRESSURE
AB A series of ZnSe crystals for fundamental studies were grown by the vertical Bridgman method under 30 atm inert gas antipressure. A critical relationship between growth velocity and axial temperature gradient for the maintenance of a morphologically stable interface of 1.5 x 10(-2) cm2 h-1 K-1 was determined. Furthermore, it has been shown that the number of twins is inversely proportional to the number of large-angle grain boundaries. Finally, the tendency of increasing improvement of the crystal quality with increasing superheating of the melt before the growth run was observed.

TI GROWTH OF TIO2 SINGLE-CRYSTALS USING THE EDGE-DEFINED, FILM-FED GROWTH
   TECHNIQUE
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
AB TiO2 boule single crystals, 15 mm in diameter and 40 mm in length, have been grown successfully using the edge-defined, film-fed growth (EFG) method.  When the Ir die top temperature is a little high, the boule crystal shape is difficult to control and we find that spiral growth occurs regardless of crystal rotation in the EFG process.  By observing the boule crystals with a polarizing microscope, stress is observed to correspond to the slot pattern on the die top.  The stress is suppressed by crystal rotation during growth.  The growth characteristics and their relation to the growth conditions are reported.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI THERMAL-STRESS ANALYSES OF BULK SINGLE-CRYSTALS DURING CZOCHRALSKI
   GROWTH - (ANISOTROPIC EFFECTS IN VARIOUS SINGLE-CRYSTALS)
SO JSME INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL SERIES A-MECHANICS AND MATERIAL ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
DE COMPUTATIONAL MECHANICS; THERMAL STRESS; FINITE ELEMENT METHOD;
   ANISOTROPY; BULK SINGLE CRYSTAL; CZOCHRALSKI GROWTH
ID GAAS; INP
AB Thermal stress analyses of Si, GaAs and InP bulk single crystals during Czochralski growth are performed for the cases of the [001] and [111] pulling directions, using a three-dimensional finite element program. Elastic anisotropy is taken into account in this program. The stress components obtained from thermal stress analysis are converted into the parameter sigma(tot) which represents the effective stress for glide strains. The values and distribution patterns of sigma(tot) obtained in the anisotropic analysis taking account of elastic anisotropy are compared with those obtained in the isotropic analysis using Young's modulus and Poisson's ratio in the {111} plane.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI FAST-ATOM-BOMBARDMENT MASS-SPECTROMETRIC STUDY OF
   BENZYLOXYCARBONYL-PROTECTED TETRAPEPTIDES CONTAINING PROLINE
SO ORGANIC MASS SPECTROMETRY
LA English
DT Article
ID PEPTIDE DERIVATIVES; FRAGMENTATIONS; MATRIX
AB Fragmentations of N-benzyloxycarbonyl-protected tetrapeptide ethyl esters containing L-alanine and L-proline, in which changes in the numbers and positions of prolyl residues were observed, were studied by negative-ion fast atom bombardment mass spectrometry. A significant difference was found among the abundances of the molecule ions and the fragment ions formed by the cleavage of the benzyloxycarbonyl group, depending on the numbers and positions of prolyl residues in the derivatives. The results indicate that the conformational differences in the tetrapeptide derivatives due to the existence of proline affect fragmentations of molecules in the solution phase in negative-ion fast atom bombardment mass spectrometry.
RP TSUNEMATSU, H (reprint author), FUKUOKA UNIV,FAC PHARMACEUT SCI,8-19-1 NANAKUMA,JONAN KU,FUKUOKA 81401,JAPAN.

TI FORMATION OF A XI-HYPERNUCLEUS AND TRANSITIONS TO DOUBLE-LAMBDA STATES
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID EXCHANGE-POTENTIAL APPROACH; BARYON-BARYON SCATTERING; P-SHELL; NUCLEON
AB A scenario is given.for the formation of XI- states and the transitions to states with double-LAMBDA in anticipation of observations, especially in the KEK-E224 experiment. First, the production cross sections of XI- hypernuclear states by (K-, K+) reactions are calculated within the framework of the distorted-wave impulse approximation. Next, the transition rates from XI- hypernuclear states to possible double-LAMBDA states are obtained, which are closely related to single- and double-LAMBDA emissions after the XI-p-->LAMBDALAMBDA conversion in nuclei.

TI MODEL FOR NL10 THERMAL DONORS FORMED IN ANNEALED OXYGEN-RICH
   SILICON-CRYSTALS
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID HEAT-TREATMENT CENTERS; NUCLEAR DOUBLE-RESONANCE; ELECTRON-SPIN
   RESONANCE; CZOCHRALSKI SILICON; NITROGEN; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE;
   SPECTROSCOPY; COMPLEXES; DEFECTS; NL8
AB Electron spin resonance (ESR) studies have shown that NL10 thermal donors are formed in oxygen-rich silicon (Si) crystals after annealing. In initial NL10 formation stage, it has C(2v) symmetry with the principle g values g[100]= 1.99982, g[011BAR]= 1.99799, g[011]= 1.99946. After annealing, however, we could detect ESR signals with g values close to those of NL10 in nitrogen-doped oxygen-rich Si crystals. The ESR signals corresponded to nitrogen-oxygen complex donors [D(N,O)s]. We studied the similarities between D(N,O)s and NL10 centers with C2v symmetry. We propose a model for NL10 thermal donors that NL10 with C2v symmetry is D(N,O). Our model clearly explains NL10 thermal donors characteristics.
RP HARA, A (reprint author), FUJITSU LABS LTD,10-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI 24301,JAPAN.

TI SPIRAL GROWTH OF RUTILE SINGLE-CRYSTAL BOULES IN THE EDGE-DEFINED,
   FILM-FED GROWTH-PROCESS
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9th American Conference on Crystal Growth (ACCG-9)
CY AUG 01-06, 1993
CL BALTIMORE, MD
SP AMER ASSOC CRYSTAL GROWTH, USAF OFF SPONSORED REG, NASA, NATL SCI FDN, AESAR ALFA JOHNSON MATTHEY, LITTON SYST, AIRTRON DIV, APPL TECHNOL INC, CERES CORP, CLEVELAND CRYSTALS, CRYSTAL ASSOC INC, CRYSTAL TECHNOL INC, CRYSTALLOD INC, DELTRONIC CRYSTAL IND, ENGELHARD CORP, JOHNSON MATTHEY ELECTR, JOHNSON MATTHEY INC, LASER DIODE INC, LIGHTNING OPT, MR SEMICON INC, SAINT GOBAIN NORTON, SENSORS UNLIMITED INC, STRUERS LOGITECH, SUMITOMO ELECT CORP, VIRGO OPT
AB Spiral growth of rutile crystal boules, obtained by the edge-defined, film-fed growth (EFG) method, is analyzed using the results of radiative spectral measurements of the die top during crystal growth. The observation of spiral growth is connected with the absorption of thermal radiation in the growing crystal which shields the heat transfer from the die top. In such a case, the temperature distribution on the dic top is largely dependent on the location of the growing crystal on the die top. The meniscus tends to move to an area free from growing crystal on the die top. This results in an asymmetry of the temperature distribution which is difficult to change and a spiral crystal results.
RP MACHIDA, H (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RI Fukuda, Tsuguo/D-1309-2010
CR BRANDLE CD, 1987, J CRYST GROWTH, V85, P223, DOI 10.1016/0022-0248(87)90226-0
   BRUNI FJ, 1978, CRYSTALS GROWTH PROP, V1, P53
   MACHIDA H, 1991, J CRYST GROWTH, V112, P835, DOI 10.1016/0022-0248(91)90142-R
   MACHIDA H, 1992, JPN J APPL PHYS 2, V31, pL974, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.31.L974
   MACHIDA H, 1993, J CRYST GROWTH, V128, P829, DOI 10.1016/S0022-0248(07)80053-4

TI STRUCTURE OF THE INCOMMENSURATE COMPOSITE CRYSTAL [SR2CU2O3][CUO2]X
   (X=1.436)
SO ACTA CRYSTALLOGRAPHICA SECTION B-STRUCTURAL SCIENCE
LA English
DT Article
AB [Sr2Cu2O3][CuO2]x (x = 1.436), M(r) = 487.5, orthorhombic,         [GRAPHICS] a = 11.457(5), b = 13.409 (9), c1 = 3.935 (3), c2 = 2.740 (2) angstrom, k1 = b* + 1.436 (2)c1*, k2 = b* + 0.696 (1)c2*, V1 = 604.5, V2 = 420.9 angstrom3, Z = 4, D(x) = 5.36 Mg m-3, Mo Kalpha, lambda = 0.71073 angstrom, mu = 28.9 mm-1, F(000) = 890.5, room temperature, final R = 0.057 for 314 unique reflections. The first subsystem [Sr2Cu2O3] is composed of (Cu2O3)infinity sheets perpendicular to the b axis and Sr ions coordinated to the sheet. The second subsystem is (CuO2)infinity infinite chains parallel to the c axis, which are located among the Sr ions of the first subsystem. The atomic positions are modulated along the c axis by the interactions between the two subsystems.

TI THERMOTROPIC LIQUID-CRYSTALS BASED ON OLIGOSACCHARIDES -
   N-ALKYL-1-O-BETA-D-CELLOBIOSIDES
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID CHITOBIOSE OCTAALKANOATES; DERIVATIVES
AB n-Alkyl 1-O-beta-D-cellobiosides with an alkyl length ranging from 7 to 18 in carbon number m were synthesized, and their thermal properties were studied in comparison with those of the already-known monosaccharide homologues, n-alkyl 1-O-beta-D-glucopyranosides. The cellobiosides were found to exhibit a thermotropic mesophase at higher temperatures than the glucopyranosides. Depending on m and thermal history, the cellobiosides showed various textures such as homeotropic, transient batonnets, polygonal, and fan-shaped textures. Like in the case of the monosaccharide homologues, the difficulty of aligning the samples prohibited a full classification of the mesophase, but the X-ray diffractograms of the unaligned cellobiosides indicated that their mesophase belongs to smectic A(or less possibly, smectic C). The m dependence of the lamella thickness was much weaker than (about half) that of the monosaccharide homologues. Possible molecular arrangements of the cellobiosides in the mesophase were presented.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.

TI COORDINATION IN EVOLUTIONARY MULTI-AGENT-ROBOTIC SYSTEM USING FUZZY AND
   GENETIC ALGORITHM
SO CONTROL ENGINEERING PRACTICE
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT IEEE Workshop on Neuro-Fuzzy Control: Instrumentation and Control
   Applications
CY 1993
CL MURORAN, JAPAN
SP IEEE, MURORAN INST TECHNOL
DE MULTI-AGENT-ROBOTIC SYSTEM; MOTION PLANNING; OPTIMIZATION; LEARNING
   SYSTEM; EVOLUTION; GENETIC ALGORITHM; FUZZY SYSTEMS
ID POLYHEDRAL OBSTACLES; PATH
AB This paper deals with a new strategy for motion planning of a multi-agent-robotic system which is a decentralized configuration. All the robots do not communicate globally at the same time. but some robots do locally and coordinate to avoid competition for a public resource. Each robot plans its motion using empirical knowledge. Through iterations, each robot acquires knowledge of its environment expressed by fuzzy logic. The Genetic Algorithm is applied to optimization. For illustration, this paper deals with path planning and shows the effectiveness by simulations.

TI THE RADIAL SELECTIVITY OF IN-SITU CORE-DOPED CRYSTAL RODS GROWN BY THE
   DOUBLE DIE EFG METHOD
SO CRYSTAL RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID LASER
AB The radial selectivity of in-situ core-doped Cr, Nd:LiNbO3 crystal rods, grown by the double die EFG (edge-defined film fed growth) method, has been investigated. Two crucibles are combined with an outer and inner die for ascending of different doped melts. The critical growth parameters affected by the diffusion depended spreading effect of the dopant within the melt meniscus have been estimated. The first experimental tests show a good agreement with the theoretical prediction. Single crystalline LiNbO3 rods with a length of about 100 mm and an outer diameter of 5 mm consisting of sharp separated inner Cr- or Nd-doped core region with diameters between 1.5 and 4 mm were grown successfully.
RP RUDOLPH, P (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,2-1-1 KATAHIRA,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI GROWTH OF 2-METHY-4-NITROANILINE (MNA) CRYSTALS BY THE BRIDGMAN METHOD
SO CRYSTAL RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
AB Organic single crystals of 2-methyl-4-nitroaniline (MNA) up to 3 mm in diameter and 20 mm in length have been successfully grown by the Bridgman method using the purified reagent by sublimation.  The crystals are transparent and yellow in colour by controlling the growth conditions.  In the spectra of yellow coloured crystals no absorption peak is observed until about 450 nm.  Also, the crystals of MNA have the two cleavage planes (311BAR) and (010).

TI CHARACTERIZATION OF DISLOCATIONS IN A LINBO3 SINGLE-CRYSTAL GROWN BY
   MICRO-PULLING-DOWN METHOD
SO CRYSTAL RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID FIBERS
AB LiNbO3 single crystals grown by the micro pulling down (mu-PD) method have been revealed to be as free of dislocations and subgrain boundaries up to 500 mum in diameter.  On the other hand, mu-PD LiNbO3 single crystals grown along the x-axis in diameter of 800 mum were observed to be dislocated due to the size effect of crystal.  The Burgers vectors of dislocations were determined to be [22BAR01].  [101BAR1], and [01BAR11] by X-ray topography.

TI CONNECTION ADMISSION CONTROL IN ATM NETWORKS
SO IEICE TRANSACTIONS ON COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE ATM; CAC; CONNECTION ADMISSION CONTROL; PRIORITY CONTROL; CELL LOSS
   RATE; CLR
AB The connection admission control is one of preventive traffic control in ATM networks. The one objective of connection admission control is to keep the network load moderate so as to achieve a performance objective associated with quality of services (QOS). Because the cell loss rate is more sensitive to offered load than the average queuing delay in ATM networks, QOS requirement associated with cell loss rate is considered. The connection admission control acts as one of the major roles in traffic control. The job of connection admission control is to make an acceptance decision for connection set-up request to control the network load. This paper proposed and evaluated a connection admission control method. The proposed method is suitable for real time operation even in large diversity of connection types, because the amount of calculation for connection admission control is reduced remarkably compared to conventional algorithms. Moreover, the amount of calculation for the algorithm does not increase even when the number of connection types increases. The proposed method uses probability function for the number of cells transferred from multiplexed connections and uses recursive equations in estimating cell loss rate.
C1 TOSHIBA CO LTD,KANSAI RES LAB,KOBE 658,JAPAN.

LA English

DE (R,BI)(AL,GA)(3)(BO3)(4) HUNTITE; BORATES; FLUX GROWTH; 2ND HARMONIC
   GENERATION; CRYSTAL STABILITY; X-RAY DIFFRACTION ANALYSIS
ID NDAL3(BO3)4
AB Huntite structure crystals with a basic formula (R, Bi)(Al, Ga)(3)(BO3)(4) (R=Yb, Er, Ho and its combinations) have been grown by spontaneous crystallization in molten fluxes based on the Bi2O3-B2O3 X-ray powder diffraction patterns and cell parameter data are reported. TI PROPAGATION AND TERMINATION PROCESSES IN FREE-RADICAL COPOLYMERIZATION
   OF STYRENE AND ETHYL ACRYLATE
SO POLYMER
LA English
DT Article
DE RADICAL COPOLYMERIZATION; RATE CONSTANTS; PENULTIMATE EFFECT
ID RATE CONSTANTS; METHYL-METHACRYLATE; KINETICS; SYSTEM; POLYMERIZATION;
   MODEL
AB The propagation and termination processes in free-radical copolymerization of styrene (1) and ethyl acrylate (2) in the bulk at 40-degrees-C were examined by the rotating-sector technique. A marked penultimate-unit effect was observed for the terminal radical 1 (s1 = 0.27), in conformity with the prediction of the stabilization energy model. The concentration of the terminal radical 2 in this system was too small for the details about this radical to be elucidated. The termination process conforms to the notion of diffusion control, but conclusively not to that of chemical control. The experimental data, however, were not described very accurately by the North diffusion model. An alternative simple, no-parameter model, conceptually analogous to the Ito-O'Driscoll model, was proposed and found to describe the experiments better.

TI FORMATION AND TRANSITION OF STRANGENESS-EQUALS--2 NUCLEAR SYSTEMS
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID EXCHANGE-POTENTIAL APPROACH; LAMBDA-LAMBDA-HYPERNUCLEI; BARYON-BARYON
   SCATTERING; WEAK DECAY; XI CAPTURE; P-SHELL
AB A scenario is given for the formation of Xi(-) states and the transitions to states with double-Lambda. First, the production cross sections of Xi hypernuclear states by (K-, K+) reactions on typical two targets (C-12 and O-16) are calculated within the framework of the distorted-wave impulse approximation. Next, the transition rates from Xi(-) hppernuclear states to possible double-Lambda states are evaluated, which are closely related to single- and double-(Lambda emission after Xi(-) p--> Lambda Lambda conversion in nuclei. The partial conversion widths for the atomic Xi(-) absorption by C-12 and O-16 are also estimated in the similar way, discussing various possible final states. In order to extract an information on the Xi-N interaction, the cross sections and Xi state widths are given as a function of the Woods-Saxon well depth for the Xi particle. The result is discussed in anticipation of observations in future experiments.

TI THERMOLUMINESCENCE DATING OF A CALCITE SHELL, CRASSOSTREA-GIGAS
   (THUNBERG) IN THE OSTREIDAE FAMILY
SO QUATERNARY SCIENCE REVIEWS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 7th International Specialist Seminar on Thermoluminescence and Electron
   Spin Resonance Dating
CY JUL 05-09, 1993
CL KREMS, AUSTRIA
AB The thermoluminescence (TL) spectra and first TL glow growth of a calcite shell of Crassostrea gigas (Thunberg) in the Ostreidae family (abbreviated to gigas) are investigated. It is found that these TL characteristics are the same as those of the Pectinidae family, and that TL dating is feasible for fossil gigas.

TI EFFICIENT LASER-DIODE-PUMPED NEODYMIUM-DOPED
   CALCIUM-NIOBIUM-GALLIUM-GARNET LASER
SO APPLIED OPTICS
LA English
DT Article
AB Efficient lasing of Nd:Ca (Nb, Ga)(2-x) Ga-3-garnet (CNGG) disordered crystal pumped by a laser diode was demonstrated. In the end-pumped cw lasing experiment with a single-stripe diode, a slope efficiency of 24.2% and a maximum optical conversion efficiency of 19.3% were obtained. It was shown that the dependence of cw output power on the pump wavelength is insensitive compared with Nd:YAG because of the broad pump absorption bandwidth of Nd:CNGG. From the diode-bar-pumped experiment, it was confirmed that Nd:CNGG is a promising material for diode-bar pumping to obtain high average power with good beam quality, because of its advantages of a broader pump absorption band compared with that of Nd:YAG and the higher thermal conductivity compared with Nd-doped glasses.
C1 TSUKUBA RES CONSORTIUM, JRDC, ERATO, KIMURA METAMELT PROJECT, TSUKUBA, IBARAKI 30026, JAPAN.

TI PROPAGATION AND TERMINATION PROCESSES IN THE FREE-RADICAL
   COPOLYMERIZATION OF METHYL-METHACRYLATE AND VINYL-ACETATE
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID RATE CONSTANTS; STYRENE; KINETICS; SYSTEM; MODEL
AB The propagation and termination processes in free-radical copolymerization were examined on the basis of a complete set of experimental data carefully obtained for the bulk copolymerization of methyl methacrylate (MMA) and vinyl acetate (VAc) at 40-degrees-C by use of the rotating-sector technique. The composition curve conformed to the terminal model within experimental error. However, a moderate penultimate-unit effect was observed for the terminal MMA radical (s1 = k211/k111 = 0.4 +/- 0.2), in conformity to the prediction of the stabilization energy model. The concentration of the terminal VAc radical was too small to elucidate the details about this radical. The termination process in this system conforms to the notion of diffusion control, but the North diffusion model was found inadequate.  Alternative, simple, no-parameter models were proposed, which described the experiments better.

   FUKUDA, T
TI ACCOMMODATION RESPONSE TO BINOCULAR STEREOSCOPIC TV IMAGES AND THEIR
   VIEWING CONDITIONS
SO SMPTE JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
AB The accommodation response of subjects viewing binocular stereoscopic TV images was measured with an objective infrared optometer Tt was found that the subjects' eyes showed clear response corresponding to variation of the left-right (L-R) image separation when this was relatively small, and it saturated when the separation was larger: The amplitude of the response change depended mainly on the amount of L-R image separation. From these results suitable viewing conditions were determined and are discussed in this article.

TI SCANNING-TUNNELING-MICROSCOPY STUDY OF DEOXYGENATED AND DEIONIZED WATER
   RINSED GAAS(111)-B SURFACES
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article
ID RUNNING DEIONIZED WATER; RAY PHOTOELECTRON-SPECTROSCOPY; GAAS-SURFACES;
   RECONSTRUCTIONS; DEPENDENCE
AB GaAs(111)-B (arsenic terminated) surfaces prepared by rinsing with running deoxygenated and de-ionized water (DODIW) were investigated by scanning tunneling microscopy in ultrahigh vacuum. After annealing the sample, As-rich 2 X 2 reconstruction was found between 415 and 500-degrees-C. Above 500-degrees-C, Ga-rich square-root 19 X square-root 19-like structures were also found around As desorbed triangular valleys. Although details of the reconstructions were slightly different from molecular-beam epitaxially grown surfaces, similar temperature dependence proved that DODIW-treated surfaces were effectively passivated against oxidation.

TI GAS PUFF MODULATION EXPERIMENTS ON JT-60U
SO NUCLEAR FUSION
LA English
DT Article
ID HEAT PULSE-PROPAGATION; TRANSPORT-COEFFICIENTS; PARTICLE-TRANSPORT;
   TOKAMAK; DIFFUSION; PLASMA; JET
AB Density and temperature modulations were induced in JT-60U plasmas using sinusoidal modulation of gas puff injection. From an analysis of the density modulation, the particle diffusion coefficients were evaluated to be 0.2 m(2)/s in the central region and 0.8 m(2)/s in the edge region of ohmically heated plasmas. Furthermore, from an analysis of the electron temperature modulation, the ratio of the heat and particle diffusion coefficients, chi(e)/D, was estimated to be between 5 and 10.

TI CRYSTAL-GROWTH OF HUNTITE-BORATES DOPED WITH LI+, SI4+, GE4+, TI4+, V5+,
   CR3+, MN4+ AND ND3+ FROM HIGHLY CONCENTRATED MOLTEN FLUXES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE HUNTITE; BORATE; MOLTEN FLUX; SPONTANEOUS CRYSTALLIZATION; CRYSTAL
   STABILITY
AB Bi-containing crystals of YbAl3(BO3)4 and ErAl3(BO3)4 with the huntite structure doped with Si4+, Ge4+ and transition metal cations Ti4+, V5+, Cr3+ and Mn4+ have been grown by spontaneous crystallization from fluxes based on Bi2O3-B2O3-Li2O. The Li+ cation was used for charge compensation of the crystal structure. The concentration of crystal-formed oxides was 43-96 mol% and the achieved productivity (crystal/melt weight ratio) was about 77 wt%. The dependences of crystal stability and chemical properties of prepared materials on crystal composition were discussed.

TI VIBRONIC STRUCTURES AND ANISOTROPY OBSERVED IN LINEAR AND
   NONLINEAR-OPTICAL SPECTRA OF VACUUM-DEPOSITED POLYTHIOPHENE THIN-FILMS
SO SYNTHETIC METALS
LA English
DT Article
ID CONJUGATED POLYMERS; ELECTRICAL-CONDUCTIVITY; 3RD-HARMONIC GENERATION;
   SUSCEPTIBILITY; SPECTROSCOPY; ABSORPTION; POLY(THIENYLENE)S;
   PHOTOEXCITATION; MOLECULES; COMPLEXES
AB Linear and   chi(3) spectra of vacuum-deposited thin films of polythiophene (PTh, prepared by an organometallic process) show vibronic structures with an energy difference of about 1500 cm-1 (0.19 eV). The vibronic structure is more clearly observed in the chi(3) Spectrum and is considered to originate from coupling with the nu(c=c) vibration of the thiophene ring. Large chi(3) anisotropy with a chi parallel-to (3)/chi perpendicular-to (3) value of about six is observed with the PTh film vacuum deposited on substrates covered with a rubbed poly(p-phenylene) thin layer.

TI SYNTHESIS AND SEARCH FOR EQUILIBRIUM COMPOSITIONS OF BORATES WITH THE
   HUNTITE STRUCTURE
SO JOURNAL OF CRYSTAL GROWTH
LA English
DT Article
AB Using the Bi2O3-B2O3 Solvent, single crystals of (Ho,Bi)(Al,Ga)3(BO3)4, (Yb,Bi)Al3(BO3)4:Nd3+,(Er,Bi)Al3(BO3)4:Cr3+ and (Er,Bi)Ga3(BO3)4:Cr3+  with the huntite structure have been grown by spontaneous crystallization from a flux. The achieved productivity of the melt (crystal/melt weight ratio) was 38 wt%. The crystal composition and distribution coefficients for different cation positions were studied and the dependence of the probability of congruent melting on crystal composition was discussed. X-ray powder diffraction analysis data for grown crystals are presented.

   KOIZUKA, M
TI THE 900-DEGREES-C UPPER YIELD STRESS OF CZOCHRALSKI SILICON
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS WITH CARBON CONCENTRATIONS OF 4.0X10(14) AND 3.5X10(15)
   CM(-3)
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID OXYGEN-ATOMS; GROWTH; BEHAVIOR; PRECIPITATION
AB In order to investigate the influence of carbon on the high-temperature strength of Czochralski silicon single crystals, we measured the 900-degrees-C upper yield stress of crystals containing carbon at concentrations of 4.0 X 10(14) cm-3 (''low C'') and 3.5 X 10(15) cm-3 (''standard C''). Prior to testing, all crystals were beat treated for 20 h at 700-degrees-C. They were then annealed at 1000-degrees-C for periods between 1.5-7 h. During the longest anneal, the interstitial oxygen content fell from 2.0 X 10(18) to 1.0 X 10(18) cm-3  in low C crystals and from 1.9 X 10(18) to 7 X 10(17) cm-3   in ''standard C'' crystals. The 900-degrees-C upper yield stress of 7 h annealed low C crystals is 13 MPa, which is 30-40% higher than that measured in standard C crystals. The precipitate density, measured optically, is 4 X 10(5) cm-2  in low C samples and 9 X 10(5) cm-2   in standard C crystals. In all cases, the precipitates punched out dislocations. A model that assumes that the higher interstitial oxygen content retained by the low C crystals results in higher locking stresses for glide dislocations can quantitatively account for these observations.
RP FUKUDA, T (reprint author), FUJITSU LABS LTD,SEMICOND DEVICES LAB,10-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI 24301,JAPAN.

TI TIO2 THIN-FILMS FORMED BY ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON-RESONANCE PLASMA OXIDATION
   OF TI THIN-FILMS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE THIN FILMS; ECR; PLASMA OXIDATION; TIO2; CAPACITANCE
ID SRTIO3
AB TiO2 thin films with a relative-dielectric constant of 20 were fabricated by electron cyclotron resonance (ECR) Plasma oxidation of Ti thin films without substrate heating. The relative-dielectric constant was found to be constant for film thicknesses from 3.5 to 26 nm, and the maximum capacitance of 37 fF/mum2 was obtained for the thickness of 3.5 nm.

AF KANG, JY
   IIDA, SH
   HUANG, QH
   FUKUDA, T
TI PHOTOLUMINESCENCE PROPERTIES OF SN-RELATED DONOR STATE IN ALXGA1-XAS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE ALLOY; IMPURITY; DONOR; PHOTOLUMINESCENCE; DYNAMIC BEHAVIOR
ID DOPED ALXGA1-XAS; GAAS; SI; ALLOYS; MODE
AB We have investigated the near-gap recombinations in Sn-doped AlxGa1-xAs by photoluminescence. By analyzing the variations of spectral lineshapes under various excitation intensities, only one type of recombination was assigned to associate with the Sn-related donor state, which was different from the hydrogenlike shallow donor states and the DX centers. Phonon replicas were observed to accompany the recombination in the samples with high AlAs mole fractions of direct gaps, as well as in those of indirect gaps. The Franck-Condon shift and the phonon energy of the recombination were found to increase with increasing AlAs mole fraction. This behavior was explained in terms of a variation of local lattice distortion around an ionized Sn-related donor and a weighted average of two local vibrational mode frequencies of the Sn-related donor.
C1 NAGAOKA UNIV TECHNOL,NAGAOKA 940,JAPAN.
   XIAMEN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,XIAMEN 361005,PEOPLES R CHINA.
RP KANG, JY (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RI Kang, J/G-4108-2010; Fukuda, Tsuguo/D-1309-2010

TI TIME-DOMAIN SPECTROSCOPY FOR ELECTRICAL-PROPERTIES OF A SLIGHTLY REDUCED
   RUTILE CRYSTAL
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article
DE TIME DOMAIN SPECTROSCOPY; LUMPED CAPACITANCE METHOD; DIELECTRIC
   DISPERSION; DIELECTRIC RELAXATION; CONDUCTIVE MATERIALS; COLE-COLE TYPE
   EQUATION; NONSTOICHIOMETRIC RUTILE; 4-PROBE METHOD
AB A method of measuring the electrical properties of conductive materials by a lumped-capacitance time-domain spectroscopy is described. The properties of a slightly reduced rutile crystal are investigated in the temperature range between 100 K and 290 K. Reflected waves from the sample, observed by a time domain reflectometer, are analyzed by separating the imaginary part of the complex permittivity into two terms; one term characterizes dc electric conductivity and the other the dielectric property of the sample. Each dielectric dispersion is represented by a double Cole-Cole type equation. We have obtained dc resistivities which agree well with the results obtained by a four-probe method, using the relationship, by Spenke, between relaxation time and dc resistivity.
C1 TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
   TOHOKU UNIV,SCI MEASUREMENTS RES INST,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
   TOHOKU UNIV,INST MAT RES,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.
RI Fukuda, Tsuguo/D-1309-2010
CR BABA K, 1987, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V26, P479, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.26.479
   BABA K, 1985, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V24, P1532, DOI 10.1143/JJAP.24.1532

   MIYAMOTO, T
TI ORIENTATION-DEPENDENT INTERACTIONS IN POLYMER SYSTEMS .3. SEGMENTAL
   ORIENTATION IN POLY(2,6-DIMETHYL-1,4-PHENYLENE OXIDE) POLYSTYRENE
   MISCIBLE BLENDS
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID DEUTERIUM MAGNETIC-RESONANCE; INFRARED DICHROISM; ELASTOMERIC NETWORKS;
   RUBBER ELASTICITY; MELT RHEOLOGY; LATTICE MODEL; CHAIN; RELAXATION;
   ORDER; BIREFRINGENCE
AB The segmental orientations in a uniaxially stretched, fully entangled polystyrene (PS) melt containing a small amount (3% by weight) of poly(2,6-dimethyl-1,4-phenylene oxide) (PPO) were studied as a function of the molecular weight of PPO, M(n,2), by means of infrared dichroism spectroscopy. The PS matrices were either cross-linked (by use of divinylbenzene) or un-cross-linked.  At time t = 0, i.e., immediately after a stretch was applied to the blend film, both PS and PPO segments showed finite orientations eta1 and eta2, respectively, where eta denotes the order parameter P2(cos theta). The eta2/eta1 vs M(n,2) curves for the cross-linked and un-cross-linked systems at t = 0 were very similar to each other: for M(n,2) less than or similar to 10(3), the orientation ratio eta2/eta1 increased With increasing M(n,2), approaching a plateau for 10(3) less than or similar to M(n,2) less than or similar to 10(4), where eta2/eta1 congruent-to 0.5. With a further increase in M(n,2), eta2/eta1 steeply increased, approaching another plateau, where eta2/eta1 = 2.7 (un-cross-linked systems) or 1.7 (cross-linked systems). This enormous increase in eta2/eta1 is ascribed to the entanglement interaction of PPO chains with the PS matrix. Examination of the cross-linked systems, where the matrix orientation did not relax owing to the cross-links, has revealed that PPO segments exhibit a finite, unrelaxing orientation with a constant eta2/eta1 ratio of about 0.4 in both unentangled and entangled regions (excepting the oligomeric region, where eta2/eta1 depended on M(n,2). The eta2/eta1 vs M(n,2) curve in the unentangled region was substantially the same as the t = 0 curves for the cross-linked and un-cross-linked systems). This unrelaxing orientation of PPO is ascribed to the segmental interaction between PPO and PS. The packing entropy theory proposed previously (Fukuda, T., et al. Macromolecules 1992, 25, 2196) gives a reasonable description of this equilibrium orientation of PPO.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,INST CHEM RES,UJI,KYOTO 611,JAPAN.
